item.content:encoded:
Background

The Libya Transition Initiative 4 project implemented by Chemonics International aims to establish and manage a quick-response mechanism supporting activities that reinforce stability and build an inclusive and peaceful democratic future.

Purpose

The Program Development Officer (PDO) plays a central role in developing activities with carefully selected organizations that further the program’s strategic objectives, in full compliance with Chemonics regulations and policies.

Reporting

The PDO reports to the Regional Program Manager (RPM).

 

Location

Tripoli, Libya

 

Responsibilities

  • Analyze Libya’s rapidly changing environment on an ongoing basis, and contribute to program strategy, under the overall direction of the senior management team.
  • Identify potential partners, communities, and community groups within the area of responsibility where program objectives can be met and work with them to design and develop grant activities.
  • Proactively identify and conceptualize potential activities that are appropriate to respond to the established program goals and objectives and strategic priorities.
  • Develop and finalize multiple activities, on an ongoing basis, in a fast-paced and highly changeable environment.
  • Provide technical oversight of all activities and ensure alignment with regional strategy.
  • Consult with grants specialists and procurement specialists in designing the mechanism of the activities to ensure effective implementation.
  • Actively participate in the problem solving and troubleshooting throughout the grant cycle to ensure alignment with grant objectives and intention.
  • Provide technical assistance to grantees and potential grantees as required, throughout the activity cycle, to enhance implementation and address challenges.
  • Conduct regular monitoring visits to assess progress of activities, follow-up on programmatic issues, and provide regular updates to the grants management unit and senior management team on activity impact, opportunities, and problems.
  • Maintain working relationships and liaison with project counterparts.
  • Write implementation plans in a timely manner.
  • Support the Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning Specialist with contributions to monitoring and evaluation reports.
  • Provide regular updates on activity development and implementation to the grants management unit and senior management team.
  • Undertake other duties as assigned by supervisor.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required.
  • Intimate understanding of Western Libya, including key cities.
  • Minimum of three years of work experience required.
  • Fluent written and spoken English and Arabic are required.
  • Strong organizational, management and administrative skills, preferably with respect to report writing and monitoring and evaluation.
  • Demonstrated analytical ability and understanding of local and regional political context, with the ability to think creatively in conceptualizing relevant grant activities.
  • Proven experience working with governance institutions as well as with local and international NGOs and community-based organizations implementing relevant activities and programs in country.
  • An up-to-date understanding and knowledge of the political environment and social conditions in country and the surrounding region.
  • Experience and/or good understanding of donor organizations.
  • Ability/willingness to travel throughout Libya.
  • Undertake other duties as assigned by supervisor.

How to Apply?

Interested applicants can apply through the below link, deadline for accepting CVs is May 20, 2022. https://fs3.formsite.com/n3f3pk/eadgawwfyw/index.html

item.content:encoded:
Job Overview

The Trade Marketing Representative’s primary role is to directly support the local manager, handle the day-to-day administration of the office, and manage and coordinate the marketing activities of Salvo Grima in Libya. The candidate will also be responsible for the daily market surveillance regarding product availability and pricing while ensuring the highest quality of services and maintaining a positive relationship with retailers and consumers.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Leading marketing campaigns and promotional strategies.
  • Assisting in the preparation, coordination, collection, production, supervision and follow-ups of promotions and marketing events.
  • Representing Salvo Grima and its clients by maintaining a positive and professional demeanour.
  • Building and maintaining customer relationships.
  • Daily market surveillance and weekly reports.
  • Preparing daily reports on market research.
  • Initiating and analysing consumer and market research to identify market trends and target consumer preferences to improve marketing efforts.
  • Monitoring competition activity, producing a weekly market summary report.
  • Maintaining an internal database on product availability and pricing.
  • Contributing to the daily growth and development of our company.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Basic marketing and promotional principles.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
  • Ability to establish effective working relationships with colleagues and customers.
  • Ability to multitask and meet deadlines.
  • Professional appearance and demeanour.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong time management and organisational skills.
  • Outgoing, energetic, detail-oriented, and responsible.
  • Entrepreneurial attitude and ability to think outside the box with a desire to grow and learn.
  • A basic level of English would be appreciated.

item.content:encoded:
Job Description

A job description is a written statement that describes the employee’s role and responsibilities. The role and responsibilities shall be executed within the NRC framework. The job description facilitates the recruitment process by stating the necessary competencies. It is mandatory for all positions.

 

Position: Cleaner

Reports to: HR/Admin Staff

Supervision of: HR & Admin Department

Duty station: Tripoli, Libya

Travel: 0%

Project number: XXXX

Duration and type of contract: XXXX

 

All NRC employees are expected to work in accordance with the organization’s core values: dedication, innovation, inclusivity and accountability. These attitudes and believes shall guide our actions and relationships.

 

  1. Role and responsibilities

The following is a brief description of the role.

 

Generic responsibilities (max 10)

These responsibilities shall be the same for all positions with the same title. The responsibilities shall be short and essential. Details belong in the Work- and Professional Development Plan.

  1. Clean the, rooms, washrooms/WC, kitchen and other common areas such as the yard.
  2. Ensure compliance with NRC procedures and policies
  3. Ensure that cleaning supplies are properly stocked.
  4. Dust and polish furniture, windows, doors and equipment
  5. Empty waste paper baskets, dustbins and shredding machines
  6. Report any relevant gaps, damages and breakages to line manager
  7. Support the administration with ad hoc duties

Specific responsibilities

These responsibilities shall be adapted to the particularities of the job location and context, phase of operation, strategic focus and type of programme intervention. This section shall be revised whenever a new employee is hired or the context changes significantly.

  • Clean the offices, class rooms, main rooms, living rooms, washrooms/WC, kitchen and other common areas such as the yard, corridors and stairs.
  • Ensure that cleaning supplies are properly stocked.
  • Ensure that all classrooms are ready and clean before and after each session
  • Ensure the outdoor area is clean and well prepared
  • Dust and polish furniture, windows, doors and equipment are all well-stored.
  • Empty waste paper basket, dustbins and shredding machines
  • Report any relevant gaps, damages and breakages to line manager
  • Support the administration with general duties
  • Ensure the availability of all kitchen and toilet supplies at all times (i.e. soap, air freshener, tissue, coffee, tea, sugar, etc.)
  • Watering indoor and outdoor plants.

 

Critical interfaces

By interfaces, NRC means processes and projects that are interlinked with other departments/units or persons. Relevant interfaces for this position are:

  1. Competencies

Competencies are important in order for the employee and the organisation to deliver desired results. They are relevant for all staff and are divided into the following two categories:

 

  1. Professional competencies

These are skills, knowledge and experience that are important for effective performance.

 

Generic professional competencies for this position:

  • Experience from working as a Cleaner in a humanitarian/recovery context
  • Previous experience from working in complex and volatile contexts
  • Documented results related to the position’s responsibilities
  • Knowledge about own skills/profile
  • Arabic
  • Other Language is considered

Context related skills, knowledge and experience (shall be adapted to the specific position):

  • Organized, Clean and Neat
  • Knowledge in preparing various tea and coffee
  • Respectful and courteous
  • Attention to details and structured

 

  1. Behavioural competencies (max 6)

These are personal qualities that influence how successful people are in their job. NRC’s Competency Framework states 12 behavioural competencies, and the following are essential for this position:

  • Planning and delivering results
  • Working with people
  • Handling insecure environments

 

  1. Performance Management

The employee will be accountable for the responsibilities and the competencies, in accordance with the NRC Performance Management Manual. The following documents will be used for performance reviews:

  • The Job Description
  • The individual Work- and Professional Development Plan
  • The Competency Framework

 

APPLY NOW
